newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to tender Matrosov gold-mining firm stake.
newsitem.headline: Russia to tender Matrosov gold-mining firm stake.

text.p: Russia's Far Eastern Magadan region plans to hold an international investment tender for a 38 percent stake in the Matrosov joint-stock gold mining company, a regional official said on Monday.
Rudolf Badmayev, deputy chairman of the Magadan geological committee, told Reuters the sale could take place before June but that details on the terms of the sale were not yet available.
Matrosov mines the Natalka gold field, which could contain 250 tonnes of gold.
Badmayev said Deutsche Morgan Grenfell was adviser to the region on the sale.
He said Matrosov wanted to increase the amount of gold-containing ore it processes to four to five million tonnes a year from 600,000 tonnes, and to construct a new ore-processing plant.
